page_title: Agora SDK vs Amazon IVS - In-depth Feature Comparison

header.title: Agora SDK vs Amazon IVS
header.subtitle: In-depth Analysis of Real-time Audio and Video Technology

architecture.title: Core Technology Architecture Comparison
architecture.overview: Agora SDK adopts a unified SDK architecture, providing a single SDK that integrates all functions, while Amazon IVS adopts a separated architecture, separating the broadcast SDK from the player[1]. This architectural difference directly affects the development experience and functional scalability[4].

audio_video.title: Audio and Video Technology Capability Comparison
audio_video.overview: Agora has significant advantages in audio and video processing technology, especially in codec support, audio enhancement, and video effects[1]. The following chart shows the comparison of the two platforms on key audio and video technical indicators[3]:

agora_aec.title: AI-enhanced AEC Algorithm
agora_aec.description: Proprietary AI-enhanced echo cancellation algorithm, effectively eliminating echo in various complex environments[1]

agora_codec.title: Multiple Codec Support
agora_codec.description: Support for H.264, H.265, VP8, partial support for AV1, adapting to different scenario requirements[1]

agora_image.title: AI Image Enhancement
agora_image.description: Deep learning-driven image enhancement technology, improving video quality in low-light environments[3]

ivs_aws.title: AWS Ecosystem Integration
ivs_aws.description: Seamless integration with AWS services, simplifying deployment and operation processes[4]

ivs_webrtc.title: WebRTC-based Transmission
ivs_webrtc.description: Utilizing standard WebRTC protocol, ensuring wide compatibility[2]

ivs_mobile.title: Mobile Optimization
ivs_mobile.description: Performance optimized for mobile devices, supporting various mobile scenarios[4]

network.title: Network Transmission Capability Comparison
network.overview: Performance in weak network environments is a key indicator of real-time audio and video technology. Agora SDK uses proprietary transmission protocols and AI bandwidth prediction technology, performing excellently in weak network environments[1]. In comparison, Amazon IVS relies on AWS's global infrastructure to provide stable transmission[4].

platform.title: Platform Support and Compatibility
platform.overview: Agora SDK has significant advantages in platform support, providing comprehensive native SDK support, covering almost all mainstream platforms[1]. Amazon IVS, on the other hand, mainly focuses on mobile and web platforms[4].

scenarios.title: Actual Application Scenario Performance
scenarios.overview: In different application scenarios, the two platforms have their own characteristics. Agora performs particularly well in education and social live streaming scenarios[1], while Amazon IVS has advantages in projects integrated with the AWS ecosystem[3].

demo.title: Actual Effect Demonstration
demo.overview: The following video demonstrates the actual application effects of Agora SDK in different scenarios, including performance in weak network environments, beauty effects, and interactive whiteboard functionality[1].
demo.placeholder: [Video Demo Position] - Agora SDK actual effect demonstration video can be inserted here

device_coverage.title: Device Coverage
device_coverage.overview: Device coverage is an important metric for evaluating real-time audio and video SDKs. The support of Agora SDK and Amazon IVS on different devices directly affects user experience and market coverage[3].

ios.title: iOS Device Support
ios.description: The support of Agora SDK and Amazon IVS on iOS devices is shown below. Agora SDK supports a wider range of iOS device models and system versions[1].
ios.agora_version: Supports all versions of iOS 9.0 and above, including the latest iOS 17[1]
ios.agora_compatibility: Supports all iPhone 5s and above models, iPad Air and above models[3]
ios.ivs_compatibility: Supports iPhone 6s and above models, some iPad Pro and newer iPad models[2]

android.title: Android Device Support
android.description: In terms of Android device support, Agora SDK also demonstrates broader compatibility[1].
android.agora_version: Supports all versions of Android 4.4 and above, including the latest Android 14[1]
android.agora_coverage: Supports over 10,000 Android devices, including major brands such as Samsung, Huawei, Xiaomi, etc.[3]
android.ivs_coverage: Mainly supports mid to high-end Android devices, with limited support for some low-end devices[2]

conclusion.title: Selection Recommendations
conclusion.overview: Based on the above comparative analysis, we can draw the following selection recommendations[1][3]:
conclusion.agora_title: Ideal scenarios for choosing Agora SDK:
agora_scenarios: Social applications requiring rich interactive features[1]
Educational scenarios, especially those requiring whiteboard collaboration[3]
Applications with high requirements for audio and video quality and effects[1]
Applications requiring native experience support for multiple platforms[3]
Application scenarios in weak network environments[1]
conclusion.ivs_title: Ideal scenarios for choosing Amazon IVS:
ivs_scenarios: Projects already deeply using AWS services[4]
Projects requiring quick deployment of basic real-time interactive features[2]
Applications primarily for large-scale live streaming, with interaction as a supplement[4]
Cost-sensitive projects hoping to pay according to usage[2]

footer.data_source: Data Source: Public technical documentation, official specifications, and third-party evaluations
